<<<<<<< HEAD
The declaration and proclamation of the army of God, owned by the Lord of Hosts in many victories, to all the good people of God throughout England, Scotland, and Ireland, &c. whereunto is annexed 17 necessary proposals for the enthro[ning] of Gods laws ... Chamberlen, Peter, 1601-1683.
The second edition enlarged with new additions.
[3], 7 p.
Printed by J. Clowes for the authour, London : 1659.
Attributed to Peter Chamberlen. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.). Reproduction of original in Cambridge University Library.
=======

The second edition enlarged with new additions.
[3], 7 p.
Printed by J. Clowes for the authour, London : 1659.
Attributed to Peter Chamberlen. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.). Reproduction of original in Cambridge University Library.
